content: turn if preferred starting at the temporary bor row 2 rs sl1 k6 ssk k1 turn marker work chart a 16 18 20 times in each row 3 ws sl1 purl until 1 st remains before round finally remove the temporary bor the gap p2tog p1 turn marker and k1 with cc1 cut cc1 and cc2 row 4 rs sl1 knit until 1 st remains before the gap ssk k1 turn with mc and smaller needles knit until foot measures approximately 3 3 5 4 cm / 1¼ repeat row 3 and 4 until all side stitches 1⅜ 1½ inches less than the desired foot have been worked and you have just finished length row 4 there are now 19 21 23 sts on needle 2 chart a chart key gusset pick up and knit 15 17 19 sts or one stitch for every two row of the heel flap along the left edge of the heel flap and one extra stitch between the heel flap and needle 1 place the sts on needle 2 work the established ribbing on needle 1 along the right edge of the heel flap pick up the same number of sts as were picked up along the left edge place the sts on needle 2 and knit to the end of needle 2 armo socks page 3/4 toe abbreviations work the toe decreases as follows bor - beginning of round dpns - double pointed needles round 1 on needle 1 k1 ssk knit until 3 sts cc1 2 - contrast colour 1 2 remain k2tog k1 on needle 2 ssk knit until k - knit 2 sts remain k2tog k2tog - knit 2 sts together round 2 knit mc - main colour m1l - make 1 left repeat rnds 1 and 2 until 23 25 29 sts p - purl remain on needle 1 and 21 23 27 sts remain p2tog - purl 2 sts together on needle 2 and you have just finished round 2 round s - round s then repeat only round 1 until 13 15 17 sts rs - right side remain on needle 1 and 11 13 15 sts remain sl - slip on needle 2 ssk - slip slip knit st s - stitches finally work sts on needle 1 as follows k2tog ws - wrong side knit until 2 sts remain ssk there are now 11 13 15 sts on each needle cut the yarn and graft the toe finishing soak the socks in lukewarm water remove excess water by rolling the socks in a towel let dry flat or on sock blockers weave in the ends armo socks page 4/4
